meanings.definition: A substance or material that absorbs something, such as sound or moisture.
meanings.sent1: The sponge in the kitchen is one of the best absorbers of water.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel is a good absorber of spills on the table.
meanings.sent3: The towel was so thirsty, it acted like a super absorber and soaked up all the water in the sink.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor served as a natural absorber, silencing all footsteps with its thick layer of leaves.
meanings.sent5: The black hole in space was described as the ultimate absorber of light and matter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that absorbs or takes in something, such as information or energy.
meanings.sent1: The student was a quick absorber of knowledge, always eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent2: Plants are natural absorbers of sunlight, using it to grow and thrive.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat was an information absorber, always listening in on conversations to learn more.
meanings.sent4: The city was like a giant energy absorber, constantly buzzing with activity and movement.
meanings.sent5: The sponge was a versatile absorber, soaking up both water and spills effortlessly.
